org.safs.model

Class ComponentFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.model.AbstractTestRecord
      • org.safs.model.AbstractCommand
        • org.safs.model.ComponentFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TestRecordParametersInterface

    public class ComponentFunction
extends AbstractCommand
    Represents a ComponentFunction command. These are only allowed in Step tables.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • ComponentFunction

        public ComponentFunction(java.lang.String functionName,
                 java.lang.String windowName,
                 java.lang.String componentName)
        Create an instance of a ComponentFunction command to act on a specific component. This is used by our org.safs.model.commands and is not normally used by the user unless they are trying to build a custom component function.
        Parameters:
        functionName - -- the action keyword ("Click", "Select", etc.)
        windowName - -- the name of the Window on which to act
        componentName - -- the name of the Component within the window to act upon
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if these parameters are null or zero-length

    • Method Detail

        Retrieves the name of the window to act upon.

        the name of the window to act upon.

        public java.lang.String getComponentName()
        Retrieve the name of the component to act upon.
        Returns:
        the name of the component to act upon.

      • appendCommandToTestRecord

        protected java.lang.StringBuffer appendCommandToTestRecord(java.lang.StringBuffer sb,
                                               java.lang.String fieldSeparator)
        Overrides superclass to append the windowname and componentname before invoking super.appendCommandToTestRecord to append the actual command.
        Overrides:
        appendCommandToTestRecord in class AbstractCommand
        Parameters:
        sb - StringBuffer to append fields to
        fieldSeparator - character to append in between fields
        Returns:
        sb StringBuffer appended as appropriate.

      • isWarningOK

        public final boolean isWarningOK()
        Indicates if a warning is acceptable for this ComponentFunction.

        Returns:
        true if a warning is acceptable, otherwise false
        See Also:
        setWarningOK(boolean)

      • setWarningOK

        public final void setWarningOK(boolean newValue)
        Sets whether a warning is acceptable for this ComponentFunction.

        If a warning is set as acceptable, setFailureOK(false) is called to turn off failures.

        Parameters:
        newValue - true to indicate that warnings are acceptable, otherwise false
        See Also:
        isWarningOK()

      • isFailureOK

        public final boolean isFailureOK()
        Indicates if a failure is acceptable for this ComponentFunction.

        Returns:
        true if a failure is acceptable, otherwise false
        See Also:
        setFailureOK(boolean)

      • setFailureOK

        public final void setFailureOK(boolean newValue)
        Sets whether a failure is acceptable for this ComponentFunction.

        If a failure is set as acceptable, setWarningOK(false) is called to turn off warnings.

        Parameters:
        newValue - true to indicate that failures are acceptable, otherwise false
        See Also:
        isFailureOK()

      • getTestRecordID

        public java.lang.String getTestRecordID()
        Returns the string record type for this command. The set of values for ComponentFunction commands are:
        • "TF" - if failureOK is true
        • "TW" - if warningOK is true
        • "T" - if failureOK and warningOK are false

        Overrides:
        getTestRecordID in class AbstractCommand
        Returns:
        the record type of this command
